Docs.summary: Provides information about a running application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo> object is used by the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager> class for information about running applications.
## Examples The following code example gets an array of <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo> objects from the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager> object associated with the current process.

Docs.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the application.
Docs.value: The unique identifier for the application specified when the application was created by using the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For applications running under Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS), the application ID is the metabase path to the application root, such as /LM/W3SVC/1/Root/application.

Docs.summary: Gets the physical path corresponding to the application's root.
Docs.value: The physical path corresponding to the application's root.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo.PhysicalPath%2A> property is the path that was passed to the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager.CreateObject%2A> method when the application was created.

Docs.summary: Gets the virtual path corresponding to the application's root.
Docs.value: The virtual path corresponding to the application's root.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationInfo.VirtualPath%2A> property is the virtual path that was passed to the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.ApplicationManager.CreateObject%2A> method when the application was created.
